intro: Peucedanum polyactinum, commonly known as the many-seeded cowparsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant produces numerous small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and along riverbanks. Peucedanum polyactinum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions.
